frontmatter.description: You have a great business idea, that's good. Now, how will you let people know about it

node.html:
What You Need To Do For Your Business After Covid19 COVID 19 caught everybody by surprise and no one prepared through it properly. Government, Corporate, small businesses, and even working individuals Covid19 spared no one on his wake. Even know that the pandemic is not really over people are trying to find a way to cope up with the loss especially small businesses. Everyone is currently trying to recuperate a loss and finding a way to recover from all of this.

Mintzberg's 5 Ps of Strategy will help guide you on what to do with your business post-pandemic. Henry Mintzberg is a Canadian academic and author on business and management. Using Mintzberg's 5 Ps of Strategy as a guide here's a version you can apply post-pandemic.

  1. Positioning

In order to create a smart strategic decision, one must understand his/her position. It goes the same with your business, you must know your position in your environment. Who has your target market before this happened? What was your role before? And, who were your competitors? You have to understand all of this and understand where you are going. Does shutting down your operations and can you re-open your business without making any changes post-pandemic? Will you be able to recuperate your loss during the pandemic?

Many business owners are questioning the state of their business after the pandemic. Will they be able to reopen their business? However, some of the businesses are growing their business because they are in demand; like home delivery, home office tools, and gadgets. There are a lot of factors to consider and also have to consider your resilience. For now, take the necessary action to see where your business will be when the COVID pandemic is over.

  1. Planning a comeback!

A solid plan for comeback and reopening should be made in order to avoid any issue. Solid planning should be made directing you to the position you hope to be in. So the question is what you should do during this pandemic to go back being operational once it ends.

Things will only get harder if you don't have a solid plan to put in motion. So, make sure to create a plan that will help you after everything is over; Think long and hard of the steps you want to take, try to consider every scenario and every possibility.

  1. Perspective

A lot will have changed since the pandemic started. How you and your business sees the world and itself surely changes. It is important to consider the change in your perspective or how it evolved during this time. The questions like how did you respond when the pandemic started? How are you dealing with the current pandemic? All this will have an impact especially on how your employee and market see your organization after the pandemic and will determine what you can achieve post-pandemic.

  1. Projects!

The answer to all the questions above must point your goal to a set of projects for tackling your COVID-related issue. Prioritizing any projects that will future-proof your organization is a must. However, be aware that the projects you are starting will depend on the resources you currently have, start too many projects on limited resources will only cause delay and details of your plans.

  1. Preparedness

Lastly, you have to evaluate your business and yourself if you are ready to complete and tackle the projects you have a plan. There are differences between the readiness of yourself, your business, and your team so make sure to consider all the factors before starting your outline plan. There are a lot of factors that will determine the success of your post-COVID plan. You have to consider everything from resources to decision making down to a speed of execution. All these will determine who will succeed and who will fall flat.

The pandemic will no doubt change how we do business. COVID has had an unprecedented effect on the world and it is not even over yet. We must think, plan, and act on how we will be able to bounce back after everything is over.

frontmatter.title: Branding - Important Things To Do When Creating Your Brand.
frontmatter.description: You have a great business idea, that's good. Now, how will you let people know about it

node.html:
Here are the things you need to consider when branding your business.

  1. Take your time.

Rushing things usually doesn't yield a good result. There's a saying that goes "Who he runs fast, get cuts deep" and nothing can be further from the truth, even giving a name to your unborn child takes time. This is also the same when it comes to creating your brand. You cannot just simply rush it. Great work requires a lot of hours and endurance.

A lot of business owners rush things at the beginning, they want to get things out right away, want to get things out quickly. In building a brand, you have to take time to learn about yourself as a company, you have to fully grasp and know what you are doing, why you are doing it. You just have to take one at a time.

  1. Know your market!

Researching about your target market will help you build your brand, you have to know what do they want, and how they want it. In order to build a brand that they can relate to, you have to know them, walk on their shoes, and be them. In this way, you will be able to really connect with them, incorporate that to your brand, and be effective. Take your time, do the research!

  1. Test! Re-test and Test some more!

Testing will provide you with invaluable data regarding your target market. This is where you try to reach out to them whether through the newsletter, visuals, copy, or social media. There are a lot of things to consider and to learn from them. In testing, you will be able to understand a lot of things in what works and whatnot. You have to test from the font that you will use to your brand, to the way you communicate, to the color and everything. There are so many things that you can test to know what will be effective an not. The really good thing about this is you are new, you have all the time in the world and flexibility to make mistakes and correct them.

  1. Build a community

Creating a community will not only help you get your name out there but it will help you build authority. It is in fact the fastest way to get your name out there. Also, it is important to connect with people with the same mindset. You have to surround yourself with people who believe in what you wanted to do and what you can offer. And, through communicating with them you will be able to believe a better relationship with your client.

  1. Be honest and Be true!

Staying honest and true will have the people around you stay. The same people will be your brand ambassador even if you don't ask them. They will help you spread the word.

frontmatter.title: The Importance of a Website for Your Business Success
frontmatter.description: here are several reasons why a website is important for small businesses. Having a website can build your credibility,

node.html:
There are several reasons why a website is important for small businesses. Having a website can build your credibility, exposure to potential clients, and most of all, generating leads or sales. Simply, It’s your online identity.

However, many website owners are lost online and not generating any leads due to hiring a web designer who doesn’t know Digital Marketing. Many websites have a good design but not making any money or can not be found on any Search Engine. Look of a website is important, design makes your website align with your branding but a functional website is a key to success.

Reasons Why Website Is Important For Business

Most of the time, potential customers and clients rather search online to find basic information. You are missing all the potential customers and revenue if you don’t have a website. A website can answer questions regarding your business type.

According to polls and surveys. most people online would not trust a business if it does not have a website. Most people would think your business is legitimate and successful if you have a website.

It is important to hire a Web Company that is an expert in Search Engine Optimization (SEO). SEO is the process of optimizing web content to be discovered and visible through a search engine’s organic search results. In the simplest explanation, you are telling search engines that your website content is the best result for a topic you choose. SEO Optimized website can increase your online exposure, this will drive more potential customers and sales.

Most of the time, the buying process begins online. Buyers are conducting extensive research online before ever speaking to a salesperson. A website is an easy way for a customer to purchase your product or service. There are numerous advantages and benefits of an online store. In fact. most people prefer online shopping over physical stores these days. Your profits are no longer limited by a number of customers that can personally visit your business location.

Without a website for small business owners, customers won’t know you exist and you missed a lot of opportunity and revenue.

frontmatter.title: The How to's Of Launching Your Business
frontmatter.description: All types of businesses that provide services and products, doing business digitally made things easy for everyone.

node.html:
All types of businesses that provide services and products, doing business digitally made things easy for everyone. When you are starting a business, we understand it is quite scary but launching and the possibility of making it is exhilarating.

  1. Start in Gatherings.

A lot of people are still into gatherings no matter how digitalized our world nowadays. People still go to bazaars, business networking, and conferences. These occasions are a perfect way to showcase what you've got. Launching through these gatherings will help you get live and direct feedback from the customers. Also, it is a great way to widen your network and build your reputation.

  1. Social Media Launch

Even with what is mentioned above, we cannot really deny that most of us really glued to our gadgets and use social media 90% of the time on all (You know you are!) because they are accessible and a great way to connect no matter where you are. Being a businessman/woman, you need to know where your potential customer is and you want to fully utilize social medial. Using social media to market your business is not only effective but also practical. You can easily reach out to your target audience and it can get you so much exposure. Utilizing different social media platforms will boost your sales but also your popularity.

  1. Involve Your Innermost Circle

Many business owners do not want to involve the people closest to them. Many think this way "They might not like it and they might not support me" but in reality, it is the opposite getting the people close to you involved in your business will give you the support you need in terms of giving you feedback and referring you to their circle as well. The best way to do it is, gather your inner circle, explained to them what you are trying to do and what you want to achieve, explain it to them with great enthusiasm. Involving them to your plan can give you the boost you exactly need.

frontmatter.title: A Quick Guide to Website Design, What Makes a Good Website
frontmatter.description: YEvery year, the internet is getting flooded with thousands of new websites. There are billions of websites that exist.

node.html:
Every year, the internet is getting flooded with thousands of new websites. There are billions of websites that exist. With so many web pages, it can be hard and seemingly impossible to stand out. Businesses are competing with each other harder each day to get your attention. Some succeed, and some fail, does that mean you have to give up and not compete at all?

The demand for a simple yet beautiful, functional yet easy to navigate website is going to be higher than ever. This will help users to decide whether they will stay or to get the hell out of your website. There are things you consider in building a website and the issues that come with it. What makes a good website, anyway?

Website Design – The face of your company!

Why does it matter? Website design plays a significant role in making your customers stay and navigate. It says that a user has 3 seconds to decide whether they will stay or close your website. A website needs to be user-centered, starting from planning to execution.

However, does it take to get a well-designed website that gives satisfaction to users?

  • Beautiful User-interface
  • Perfect Easy Navigation
  • Engaging
  • Content provided in a concise and easily absorbed

There are a lot of factors that need to go into designing a website, and each element must work perfectly together to present what you wanted to show and provide your customer with the best experience ever. Each factor must be adjusted to keep up with the current trend and the product itself.

Content – Information is Power

While web design plays a huge factor in making a website successful, content is just a huge as the design is. The information provided on your site must be accurate, complete, and it must be the right information for your target audience.

In the process of making a website, planning what information must be provided and where it should go is critical in the way of user’s navigation. You cannot offer half of the information on one page and direct them to another page to complete it.

Navigation – Where to find what?

Navigating a website should be as easy as it comes. No user wants to figure out how your site works. Easy navigation will speed up the users’ search for information. This will make your visitor search your site longer, better, and will give them the peace of mind in where they at and the information they can receive.

The better and easier it is to navigate your website, the longer and the more like it is for users to stay and click on other pages of your site. In establishing an easy to follow directions, users will seamlessly go through the process of viewing or buying your product.

People nowadays, like everything fast, the same with your users.

frontmatter.title: Your Guide To Social Media Marketing
frontmatter.description: With all that is happening in our world right now, it is actually the time to take advantage of what social media can offer

node.html:
With all that is happening in our world right now, it is actually the time to take advantage of what social media can offer. Most people are in their house, using computers, on their laptops, and on their mobile phones. If you are not taking advantage of the trend that most people spend their time on their gadgets then you are missing out! BIG TIME!

So stay sitted, get a cup of coffee (or tea) as I guide you.

  1. SET YOUR GOAL!

I think in almost everything, the first thing you should do is setting your goal. Why don't you start asking you the basic questions (write yours now!) like "What's my objective?", "What do I want to achieve?" doing this will help you get a clearer picture when strategizing your social medial marketing. Remember, your objective/s in doing social media marketing should be in line with your business goal!

Is your list of questions complete? (good!) Now, your goals should be SPECIFIC don't dilly dally on your goals, setting a specific goal will help you put your effort in the right direction. MEASURABLE, goals you set should be measurable, this way you will be able to see the actual numbers you set for yourself and business. In setting your goals in numeric form, you will be able to adjust them accordingly. ATTAINABILITY, setting an unrealistic goal is fine (believe it or not) however, your goal should be according to your capability, resources, and time. RELEVANCY - the goals you set should relevant not only to you but to your business overall. Set your TIME-TABLE, in setting your time table you are creating a sense of urgency in order to achieve them. Sometimes a goal without a time frame will only get kick around and can cause you to procrastinate.

  1. KNOW YOUR TARGET AUDIENCE AND CREATE A BUYER PERSONAS

Knowing your target audience will help you create a strategy that will suit them perfectly. You should conduct research in order to find who they are. There is a lot of free social media analytics you can use to help you identify your target audience, with the help of each (whichever you use) you can then know how you will cater to them. Once you gather all the information, now you know your target audience, you know what do they need, their pain points with all the data you gathered, you can create a buyer's persona.

So once you created this you can now devise a campaign that will address specific pain points. Better targeting means better results.

  1. CHOOSING THE RIGHT CHANNEL

Since you already created a buyer's persona, you should be able to select the proper social media channel you need to use in order to reach them. Please know that identifying the social media channel your target audience will save you a lot of time, money, and effort. Also, know that not all social media channel is important for your business. See the image below to be guided accordingly.

  1. KNOW YOUR COMPETITOR

In any competition, knowing your competitor is half the battle. So, make a list of your top competitors and get to know them. Again, there are free platforms you can use to research your competitors. You should know what they are doing and not doing. You should study their behavior as well as how they use each social media channel. Compare your strategy with what they are doing, identify which is working and which is not. You can also adapt their strategy to yours if you see fit (there's nothing wrong with that).

Once you have done all this research and you have all the data, create a SWOT Analysis. You need to make a list of your strengths and weaknesses and compare them to your competitors.

  1. DECIDE WHICH TYPE OF CONTENT YOU WANT TO SHARE.

Once you decide which social media you want to use (one where most of your audience is) you should also decide on which content to share, know that each social media channel is unique and have specific content. Have you noticed anything about celebrities? Celebrity gathers a mass following because they know how to utilize each social media channel they are on, they know how to use it.

  1. OPTIMIZE YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA ACCOUNT

Creating social media specifically for your business is really ideal. Once you have one, make sure that it is consistent with your branding, your message, and your culture. Having consistency on your platform will make it easier for your audience to remember who you are and recognize your brand.

  1. KNOW WHEN TO POST

Knowing the best time to post your content will help you reach more of your audience. You can see in the image below what is the best time to post on each social media channel.

You should create a social media calendar, in which you can put when to post on your social media account and what to post each time. This will also create consistency in posting and sharing.

  1. ENGAGE WITH YOUR AUDIENCE.

Even celebrities engage with their fans from time to time. Interacting with your audience will create a loyal follower in which they can become your own brand ambassadors. Many businesses actually neglect this part, sharing and posting are not all that you can do to help them know you. If someone comment on your post, engage with them. Did someone send you a message? Chat with them. Not only this will create a community for your follower but you will also create trust for your brand.

  1. USE PAID PROMOTIONS.

Many people are afraid to use an ad. They think it is a waste of money and not effective. This is true and not true, let me explain.

Using social media ad is something that should not be taken lightly, you should know how to do it and when to do it. When it is done properly it will help you increase your audience quickly. So set a budget for your advertising.

  1. MONITOR AND ADAPT

Once you roled out your campaign, you should always monitor them. See where you at with your goal, see if your campaign is producing the results you wanted them to. Monitor the progress of each campaign on each platform this way you will be able to adjust and adapt. Make a report for a daily or weekly basis.
